me.ddos.doxel
Interface Polygonizer

All Known Implementing Classes:
MarchingCubesPolygonizer
public interface Polygonizer

Generates a triangle mesh from grid cells.

Author:
DDoS
See Also:
GridCell

Method Summary
 int polygonize(GridCell cell, gnu.trove.list.TFloatList positions, gnu.trove.list.TFloatList normals, gnu.trove.list.TIntList indices, int index)
          Polygonizes the grid cell.
 

Method Detail

polygonize

int polygonize(GridCell cell,
               gnu.trove.list.TFloatList positions,
               gnu.trove.list.TFloatList normals,
               gnu.trove.list.TIntList indices,
               int index)
Polygonizes the grid cell. Stores the position normal data and of the triangle's vertices in the two appropriate lists. Both data are three component vectors (x, y, z). Indices for the winding order of the vertices are stored in the indices list. The index passed to the method is the current available index. This methods returns the new current available index which will be passed in future calls.

Position and normal data needs to be ordered by vector component order (x, y, z) in the lists, but actual vector order does not matter as long as both list have the same order and correct order is properly defined in the indices list.

Vertices should be in the clock-wise winding order.

Parameters:
cell - The grid cell to polygonize.
positions - The list of position components.
normals - The list or normal components.
indices - The list of indices for the order of the vertices in the position and normal list.
index - The current available index.
Returns:
The next current available index.
